func: rbe
rbe
rbe

name:
HUE Button Event Filter 
  
 Output 1: The **initial_press** comes ALWAYS directly after you push the Button. Quickest response possible! 
  
 Output 2: The **short_release** will just appear after the **initial_press**, when you pushed the Button quick. 
  
 Output 3: The **repeat** will appear if you hold the button, and will send a message every second until you release it. 
  
 Output 4: The **long_release** will appear after the **repeat** ENDED! 
  
 -------------------------------- 
 All outputs are boolean **true** 
 -------------------------------- 
  
 The delays will reset the RBE node with a false. 
 You can adjust the times for your needs, but this worked for me prefectly.
info:
Output 1:
The **initial_press** comes ALWAYS directly after you push the Button. Quickest response possible!

Output 2:
The **short_release** will just appear after the **initial_press**, when you pushed the Button quick.

Output 3:
The **repeat** will appear if you hold the button, and will send a message every second until you release it.

Output 4:
The **long_release** will appear after the **repeat** ENDED!


--------------------------------
All outputs are boolean **true**
--------------------------------


The delays will reset the RBE node with a false.
You can adjust the times for your needs, but this worked for me prefectly.

env.name: light_ID
env.value: replace with discovered Lamp / Group ID

func: rbe
rbe

name:
HUE light / grouped_light Event Filter 
  
 Output 1: This output will send a **true** when Lights or Groups are turned on. 
  
 Output 2: This output will send a **true** when Lights or Groups are turned on AND a **false** when Lights or Groups are turned off. 
  
 Output 3: This output will send a **false** when Lights or Groups are turned off 
  
 Depending on your Situation it can be useful just to have a **true** OR **false** OR **both** states in your Flow. Thats the reason i built this Subflow. 
 Just use the Output that makes you happy :) 
  
 ----------------------- 
 All outputs are boolean  
 ----------------------- 
  
 The delays will reset the RBE nodes. 
 You can adjust the times for your needs, but this worked for me prefectly.
info:
Output 1:
This output will send a **true** when Lights or Groups are turned on.

Output 2:
This output will send a **true** when Lights or Groups are turned on AND a **false** when Lights or Groups are turned off.

Output 3:
This output will send a **false** when Lights or Groups are turned off

Depending on your Situation it can be useful just to have a **true** OR **false** OR **both** states in your Flow. Thats the reason i built this Subflow.
Just use the Output that makes you happy :)

-----------------------
All outputs are boolean 
-----------------------

The delays will reset the RBE nodes.
You can adjust the times for your needs, but this worked for me prefectly.

env.name: motion_ID
env.value: replace with discovered Motion Sensor ID

name:
HUE - Motion Sensor Event Filter 
 
 Output 1: Will send just an **true** when Motion is detected 
  
 Output 2: Will send an **true** when Motion is detected and a **false** if no motion is detected any longer. 
  
 Output 3: Will send just an **false** when no Motion is detected any longer. 
  
 ----------------------- 
 All outputs are boolean 
 ----------------------- 
  
 Most easy Subflow, but convinient when lots of sensors need to be set up.
info:
Output 1:
Will send just an **true** when Motion is detected

Output 2:
Will send an **true** when Motion is detected and a **false** if no motion is detected any longer.

Output 3:
Will send just an **false** when no Motion is detected any longer.

-----------------------
All outputs are boolean
-----------------------

Most easy Subflow, but convinient when lots of sensors need to be set up.

name: HUE API V2

rules.v: replace with discovered ID of your Button
replace with discovered ID of your Sensor
replace with discovered RID of Lamp / Group

name: This Filters the events for your Devices, you need to add the discovered IDs in the switch nodes
ATTENTION! READ FIRST - DOUBLE CLICK
info:
First you need to add your Data, IP Adress, Secret Key into the Nodes that have an **add Data** Label, then deploy.

ALL CHANGE NODES NEED TO BE EDITED WITH 
DISCOVERED ID / RID, do this step by step

name: Check inside the Subflows for additional Information
Light on / 80% / 2s transition / color temp cold 153
Light on / 50% / 1s transition / color temp warm 500
Room or Zone on / 100% / orange / 1s transition
grouped_light - DOUBLE CLICK FOR INFO
info:
(Rooms & Zones) can be controlled in almost the samme way as lights. 

Just the endpoint in the change node is different and instead of using the ID of a Room / Zone you need to use the discoverd **rid **

grouped_light is a service (rid) that is connected to the group/zone ID

name: Recall a Scene - DOUBLE CLICK FOR INFO
info:
I highly recommend to use Scenes to turn on Rooms/Zones. This is just one request to the Bridge and the rest is processed in the bridge. When 4 lights are turned on simultanious, the bridge possible wont be able to handle these requests at once.

If you have a sestup where it is needed to turn on seperate lights, then add delay nodes i front of the chhange node. 

Example: 4 Lights need to be tunes on, 
light 1 = no delay
light 2 = 200ms delay
light 3 = 400ms delay
light 4 = 600ms delay

when turning light off simultanious, this should be done in this way. Better is to turn off Rooms or Zones with one request.

name: You need one swich and subflow for every button / light / sensor / grouped_light where you want to have a response from
HUE API V2
HEADER V2
"Helper Functions for RID / ID discovery" (credits to user marc-gist for his help!)
This helps you to discover the ID / RID for Scenes / lights / grouped_light
Header Node V2 - DOUBLE CLICK FOR INFO
info:
Version 2 of the Header Node, easier setup.
You can decide by yourself which one you like to use. If your Flow is already running, no need to change.

name: Scene Name, ID, Zone Name
1 - Readme - DOUBLE CLICK
info:
This Flow is for discovering the needed IDs / RIDs. This makes it easier instead of searching in the payload of the https response from the Bridge!

**Thanks to fellow Github User @marc-gist who had this great idea and programmed the function nodes!**

"Get all Data" discovers Datapoints from:

- Rooms / Zones
- Scenes
- Devices
- Motion Sensors
- Buttons
- Lights

The process takes about 15 seconds, depending on your setup. You directly see arrays in the debug window, but the context is also stored in a variable. 

>>> No need to change anything in this Flow <<<

- By clicking "Get all Data" Inject Node, you also refresh the stored Data. 

- The "Delete" Inject Node is for deleting the storead Data if needed at some point.

name: Light Name, ID, Abilities
Room Name and ID
Devices Button and Motion
Zone Name and ID
Zone Name and ID (array)
Scene Name, ID, Room Name
Room Name and ID (array)
Motion Name, ID, Device Name
Button Name, ID, Device Name
2 - Readme - DOUBLE CLICK
info:
After you got all Data stored, you can easily access it here again, by clicking the inject nodes.

Depending on your favorite way to do it, you can get an array in response or seperate payloads for every device. 

Try it out!

name: DONT CHANGE ANY OF THESE NODES
Add your discovered ID / RID in the nodes

HUE Event Receivers for Firmware >= 1.53.1953188010 (beta release) 
 
 HUE changed the Event-Flow output in the API for groups. 
 Instead of sending payloads for every light/group seperately they changed 
 it into a payload with one big array. 
 For the reason that the response data for th group is not always at the same position 
 the array need to be converted to single payloads first. 
 All the data needed comes now directly as payload, so the switches need to be replaced with this new version 
 
 These changes can be done already, even when you dont have this Firmware. 
 You can replace your nodes to be prepared for the Update. 
 
 TO BE SAVE, BACKUP YOUR OLD FLOW BEFORE!
This is the most recent ersion of the Event Receiver Subflows
